summary: This document is an email chain from June 28, 2008, discussing compliance of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement with a September 2007 non-prosecution agreement. It involves attorneys Jack Goldberger and an Assistant U.S. Attorney, confirming that the plea agreement's terms (six months incarceration followed by one year of community control) are acceptable.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Attorney involved in negotiating and confirming compliance of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement with the non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the non-prosecution agreement and state plea agreement discussed in the email chain.

connections.description: Jack Goldberger is acting as an attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, discussing the compliance of his plea agreement.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement Signed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered into a non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Plea Agreement
events.description: A telephone conference was held to discuss Epstein's state plea agreement and its compliance with the non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Email Confirmation of Compliance
events.description: Email correspondence confirms that Epstein's state plea agreement (with six months incarceration and one year community control) complies with the non-prosecution agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The email confirms that Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement was in compliance with a September 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The plea agreement included a sentence of six months incarceration followed by one year of community control.
Attorney Jack Goldberger represented Epstein in these negotiations and confirmed the compliance via email.
The correspondence shows coordination between Epstein's defense and federal prosecutors regarding the plea deal terms.
